name: FetchGithubIssues

nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
### Get Github Issues HTTP Request 
- Edit the OWNER and REPO NAME in the respective fields
- The request is configured with query parameters of *state*, *since* and *labels*

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
### Extract Fields
Extract fields like title, comments, created_at, etc from the github api response

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
### Filter on Fields
Filter issues based on number of comments

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note3

parameters.content:
### Send message to Telegram User
- This node is configured to send *issue title* and *url* to your user id
- Create a new telegram bot using the instructions [here]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} and configure bot token in the telegram credential
- Chat ID can be your username or your username ID

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# FetchGithubIssues

## Overview
Automated workflow: FetchGithubIssues. This workflow integrates 7 different services: filter, stickyNote, telegram, scheduleTrigger, set. It contains 10 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 10
- **Node Types**: 7
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note2**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note3**: stickyNote
- **Send Message to @user**: telegram
- **Check for comments**: filter
- **Map title, url, created, comments**: set
- **Run every 10 minutes**: scheduleTrigger
- **Get Github Issues**: github
- **Error Handler for 9e08036f**: stopAndError

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
